author: Zafer G.
title: Infoblox DDI
Postcontent: We make Infoblox projects with multiple features such as IPAM, DHCP and DNS. Thanks to the DNS module and IPAM, your hand becomes very strong in the internal and external network, literally not without it. I didn't see a feature that I was uncomfortable with. Just getting the product certificates is a little troublesome. Using Infoblox as DNS, we can add A and PTR records which are helpful for lookup and reverse lookup.

title: Overall a good product
Postcontent: Easy management and user-friendly. Unlike other top DDI products like BlueCat and InfoBlock, BloxOne stands at the top. Didn't find any such yet. DNS Edge and security control could be better. Helps to manage large enterprise DDI environment easily.

author: Sanchit M.
title: Bloxone DDI is highly scalable solution and one of its kind, offered by infoblox in DDI market.
Postcontent: Its simplicity to install and its management via csp console. Its ability to retrieve ddi configuration from onprem gridmaster. author: NOT GIVEN
title: Manage your Node details at ease.
Postcontent: Bloxone DDI is a very good solution. It helps IT administrators, to manage IP Addresses in a single place. It also provides DHCP services for IP distribution and DNS to store DNS records and resolve hostnames. Not so much, but Whenever we create a new domain in the Bloxone DNS feature, it takes too much time to open the domain console. 1. We Can Easily manage the IP details from its IPAM solution. 2. IT provides DHCP functionality to dynamically assign the IP Address. 3. we Have added our DNS records to it as well.

author: NOT GIVEN
title: Good product with high license fees
Postcontent: Great DNS tool and all core network service are centrally managed The license price is very high and the feeds are limited for threat Intel Assits us in protecting the DNS service

author: Erick Salvador P.
title: Excellent DNS AND DHCP server
Postcontent: It is a very flexible tool that can be integrated into any network environment, in addition to the fact that its reports are very complete and editable. It also has a very friendly environment in which it allows you to have visibility of what is connected to your network I have no complaints about this product, the only detail is that when you open it from a mobile device, the web interface does not adapt to the size, it is very difficult to manipulate it remotely It allows ME to discover all the computers that are connected, the health status of each network segment, available hosts, even if you have dhcp configured, this tool allows you to set an ip with the mac of a computer, this is very useful in this type of environments

author: Mark Razel M.
title: Infoblox recognized as one of the leading core network services provider.
Postcontent: NIOS is one of the solutions provided by Infoblox for core network services such as DNS, DHCP and IPAM services.  It is a consolidated service managed as one in a single platform. Infoblox NIOS provides visibility across your network by consolidating data from DNS and DHCP services and eventually forming what they called the "single source of truth." which is the IPAM. It is easy to use in management since all configurations must be done on a single platform, even without direct access to appliances distributed across the network. Even though Infoblox provides robust DDI services and in terms of functionality, they are much farther from their competitor. The drawback here is how they price their product. The cost of their solution is directly proportional to their development. We are having difficulty positioning their product because of the higher cost. Sometimes, we prefer to offer another solution that can comply with clients' budgets. In today's network, most solutions reside on the cloud. If not started with the cloud, they are slowly migrating to the cloud because of cost issues and the benefits of having a solution in the cloud. Most clients are also moving to the cloud and planning on getting services through the cloud. Infoblox is currently solving this one on how they can provide the client's needs. Because this Infoblox NIOS is an on-prem solution, they are now offering the first cloud-based management of DDI. With the help of this, we have our chance now to position this kind of solution.

author: ANVAR A.
title: Infoblox Network Identity Operating System (NIOS)
Postcontent: NIOS provides a stable and all-in-one platform to deploy Critical network services such as  DHCP, DNS, IPAM, NIOS helps us to automate all above services and tasks associated so that to ensure continuous network availability and minimal business downtime The licensing cost should be waived for the primary platform, all other services also involve a cost for licensing, it suggests to provide NIOS /UI free of cost It helps to integrate DHCP DNS and IPAM in one platform and distribute it to remote locations which  reduces management time and troubleshooting security issues

author: NOT GIVEN
title: Infloblox NIOS: Automation in Networking Tasks
Postcontent: NIOS is a Network Identity Operating System from Infoblox, a virtual appliance. It automates many network tasks such as IP address management, DHCP (IP allocation)and DNS management. Nothing to dislike about as Infoblox is the best DDI management solution. To manage IP address inventory and DNS servers. It also helps to distribute IP addresses from its DHCP functionality. These all are mostly manual tasks that we can now do with so much ease. It also provides network monitoring.

author: Kishore K.
title: One of the best DNS products
Postcontent: I personally like the way the whole dashboard is designed and also the architecture with the Grid Master, reserved grid master and the resolvers. Upgrade is a lot easier when compared to a regular DNS server There are lesser abilities to view at the Backend logs, the necessity to raise up cases to get product assistance. Also Infoblox NIOS needs to be proactive in terms of addressing CVEs Simplified DNS management is one of biggest takeaway from the product and it definitely proves vital in getting the DNS Services hosted.

author: NOT GIVEN
title: Review of infoblox
Postcontent: Front dashboard is very informative, infoblox solves the issues of secops, netops and devops at our company so far. An all in one solution which help to achieve a digital transformation within the organization. clunky on server. would be very helpful if the dev team would fix the current issues being brought up and create more indepth knowledge base to assist the engineering team we use it as a firewall and automate our rules. we also use it for incident response and investigation as it provides much detailed insight into what is going on with the traffic.

author: Thilina L.
title: Superb for DNS
Postcontent: It has ISP and Enterprise level Enterprise Infoblox  had Harding QPS  Over 20000 Normally bind had 20000 QPS but this Enterprise level over 50000 QPS support and management and Upgrade Easy to live environment Enterprise-level support QPS over 50000 and its happen  more than 90% CPU usage for 50000 QPS I'm first doing the load test full then full load test support 70000 QPS  100% CPU this is changing my life and I like this product because of i learn the how to work with BGP and I was implement the same with zebra and bind on top of Linux

author: NOT GIVEN
title: Infoblox NIOS 8.5
Postcontent: DNS, DHCP and IPAM services.  Ease of Automation capabilities, Effective logging views with filters, Linux based CLI, powerful GUI. Upload of .csv files for mass DNS changes not always effective and error in a single record can corrupt / fail rest of the records. Recommendations to others considering Infoblox NIOS: Best product to use for managing internal and external dns services, dhcp services from medium to large scale orgs DNS, DHCP, IPAM, DNS automation, DNS grid solutions, internal and external NS

author: Akshay B.
title: Tough Security Solution with Some Setup Challenges
Postcontent: "BloxOne Threat Defense is great for spotting and reacting to cyber threats instantly, so you stay protected without slowing things down. It works well with your existing tools and uses the latest threat info to keep your network safe." It's easy to use. Customer support is top-notch and I used to use frequently. One thing to watch out for with BloxOne Threat Defense is that it can be a bit complex to set up and might be more expensive than some other options. It might take a bit of work to get everything just right. BloxOne Threat Defense keeps your network safe by catching cyber threats before they become serious issues. It works well with your current security setup, making it easier to protect your systems without a lot of extra effort.

author: Som Dutt S.
title: BloxOne Threat Defense
Postcontent: This is an excellent tool for managing threat which may be external and internal with reporting feature. It is easy to implement and use and it has nice customer support. We use it daily  and very to integrate for API implementation. There is nothing which I disliked about this tool. BloxOne Threat Defense helping to solve issues for client for managing various services. It is available on cloud which makes it easy to login from anywhere.

author: Andrew S.
title: Great customer service!
Postcontent: We recently had some minor with BloxOne Threat Defense and needed some immediate assistant. When we contacted them, they were swift, friendly and answered our questions within minutes! I have not yet had any ready complaints about BloxOne Threat Defense. They have helped keep ourselves secure and have provided assistance when we needed it. Using their unique analytics platform, they help monitor and stop communication between potential threats and provide overall DNS security.
